intro: Cyclosorus leptocladius, commonly known as the slender water fern, is a small, aquatic plant belonging to the family Marsileaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, floating leaves that are typically divided into four lobes, resembling a tiny four-leaf clover. The plant thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, often found in ponds, lakes, and wetlands. Its reproductive structures include small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually submerged, followed by the production of tiny, buoyant fruits. Cyclosorus leptocladius plays a role in maintaining water quality by absorbing nutrients and providing habitat for aquatic invertebrates.
